headline: Grandma's Sour Cream Pound Cake
description: Grandma's sour cream pound cake recipe is always a favorite with friends and family. It's moist and dense with a light dusting of powdered sugar.

video.description: This is a recipe the whole family loves. It's always a hit!
video.name: How to Make Grandma's Sour Cream Pound Cake

name: Grandma's Sour Cream Pound Cake
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon confectioners' sugar, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9- or 10-inch fluted tube pan (such as Bundt).
Beat sugar and butter with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light, fluffy, and lighter in color. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in vanilla.

Mix flour, salt, baking soda, and mace in a bowl. Add flour mixture to the wet ingredients alternately with sour cream, mixing until just incorporated. Pour batter into the prepared pan and spread to smooth the top.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 1 hour and 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool for 10 minutes in the pan. Invert carefully onto a serving plate and let cool completely. Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving.

review.reviewBody: I loved the recipe and this site is my go-to for any recipe. I made a few changes because I like a lighter pound cake. I used 1 cup of all purpose flour and 2 cups of self-rising (did not add any baking power or salt) I used 3 sticks of butter and a half cup of oil. The cake was delicious!
This recipe was an epic fail for me. Of course there is too much butter!
Loved it
Delicious! Especially liked the crusty outside, yum!
Delicious! A real crowd-pleaser. Used Allspice in lieu of mace on first try - worked fine.

Before trying, I read thru about 100 reviews and changed things accordingly.. 1/4 tsp baking powder, 1/4 tsp baking soda, 1 1/2 cups butter, no mace, 1 1/2 tsp pure vanilla extract, 1/2 tsp almonds extract, beat eggs 10 mins each before adding the next, be sure to butter your pan/dish completely but not clumpy or thick. Coat with flour and tap out excess. If you notice empty spots after flouring, add a dab of softened/melted butter and flour. Be sure to SMOOTH the batter as much as possible after transferring to the pan. Bake on 325 for 1 hour 20mins. Comes out perfect every time!! I've made this for Thanksgiving and Christmas for the last 3 years. It doesn't survive the day.
This pound cake is phenomenal. My brother-in-law loves pound cake and he says this is the best. (I have tried lots of recipes on him!). I occasionally add lemon zest but that’s it!
There is NOT a party or holiday that I'm not asked to make this pound cake for. There are chefs that ask me to make it! Thank you so much for sharing your family recipe.
I've made this several times and with a 9" bundt it rises too much. The last time I made it, I made 3 baby bundts along with the 9" bundt.
Leaden, heavy and tasteless. Too much butter.
Fantastic recipe ! First time to make it followed recipe and everyone loved it !!!! Will make again ....

This turned out really well. I did have a few problems but it was because of my lack of experience. My bundt pan was too small for the full recipe and I overcooked by a bit. However, in spite of this my cake still turned out good. Next time it should be perfect!!

My aunt made a sour cream pound cake when I was a kid that I absolutely loved. I've been looking for a recipe for years and this one comes the closest. I baked mine in two loaf pans and it only took an hour. LOVE IT!
Excellent! I made some modifications, I used 2C sugar , baked 325 degrees for 1 hour 15 minutes. It’s a keeper!
Best pound cake recipe I’ve tried in a while. I doubled the vanilla cause I like to.

A classic sour cream recipe I have made many times. I agree with other reviewers. This is double the amount of butter I have ever used. Perhaps it was a typo? 2 sticks of butter or one cup. Certainly not two cups! Other than that I get rave reviews from anyone who tastes it. In the final minutes of baking I pour a mixture of lemon juice and sugar on top ( 2 Tbs sugar and 2-3 TVs of lemon juice). I make two loaf pans. This doesn’t last long I my house!

I used the ingredients in this recipe exactly as written - almost. The recipe doesn’t specify salted or unsalted butter, but I assumed it was salted from the small amount of salt to be added. However, I always use unsalted butter, so I modified the recipe by increasing the amount of salt to 1 teaspoon. This is a beautiful cake that tastes delicious. I had to decrease the temperature to 325 about halfway through the bake because the top was burning. Next time I’ll bake it at 325 for the entire baking time. This recipe is definitely a keeper!

This is the second time I made this cake and my friends and family loved it! It’s super moist and scrumptious! The only thing I did different was stiff the flour. The second time I made it I added lemon zest to it.
Love it! Actually, I've made it twice. Added some personal taste changes such as topping with nuts. Everyone that taste it love the favor as well This is a can't go wrong recipe. Love, love, love it
One of my favorite pound cake recipes. I also sometimes add peaches and pecans or apples and walnuts. I coat the pan with a mixture of sugar and cinnamon to add a bit of extra flavor.
Best recipe ever. I have been using this recipe for at least 5 years for breakfast and dessert.

I should have paid more attention to reviews. Way too much butter. I usually use 1.5 cups. I am a seasoned home baker. This cake was heavy and greasy. 
I will use it in a trifle.
NO I DIDN'T MAKE ANY CHANGES.
OH MY! followed the directions exactly and ended up wit h a super moist cake that grandma would be proud to eat!

This is fabulous! 
Thank you for sharing your recipe, @LVJOANNE. The only thing is I got confused the first time I tried it because the baking soda and salt are not listed in the directions. I added them to the flour mixture and it was fantastic. EDIT: I see the online recipe has been edited since I printed it out. Thanks!
I’ve made several pound cakes from this site that were very good-but this one takes the cake!
I did not use mace, nor a substitution. I baked it at 325° 
It makes enough batter to fill my “Heritage” Bundt pan and a loaf pan. It freezes well and stays so moist.

I halved the recipe to make in a loaf pan. Adjusted temp to 325 because my oven runs hot, and baked for one hour. Dense, moist and delicious! Thank you, LVJoanne! Another reviewer suggested greasing the pan and then using sugar instead of flour. I did that even though I wasn't using a bundt pan (duh), but the outer crust of the loaf had a wonderful crunch to it that I will repeat next time using the bundt.
I added 1/2 tsp. of lemon flavoring. I also baked at 325 degrees for 1 hr and 20 min. It was delicious.
My favorite pound cake! Everyone loves it.

Save your time, ingredients, and cooking time! I should have read the reviews before making this cake. I thought I'd done something wrong, and even went to my 82 y.o. mom for advice on what I may have done wrong... it wasn't me, it's the cake. You could tell something was wrong when you dumped it onto a plate. It's so heavy & saturated with butter, it caved in on itself in the middle while it was cooking; I mean there was literally a dent all around the cake. When you cut a piece and look at the inside you can see a different color which led me to think it wasn't cooked long enough, even though I cooked it like the recipe called for. Nope, that was butter. YUCK!!!

Oh my gosh!! Such buttery goodness!!! I just deleted all of my pound cake recipes. This is my new favorite and i have made many in my lifetime. The outside had a delicious crunchy crust and inside was this marvelous soft, yummy, pillow of flavor!! Thank you ALL RECIPES!!

I made the pound cake last month my husband requested that I make it again I love the cake it’s gets better each day the butter and the nutty taste of the nutmeg is a beautiful combination thumbs up for the recipes
I loved the recipe. Very easy to follow and the cake was moist and delicious! I did substitute all purpose flour for cake flour.
I followed the recipe to the letter. My family loved it. I will be making it again.
This is the best cake ever!
I've made this cake about 6 times for friends and they can't get enough..
DO NOT USE 2 CUPS/4 STICKS OF BUTTER! It will ruin this cake. Only use two sticks/1 cup of butter
Love it

I made this cake a few days ago. I took the suggestions from the comments and added the baking powder. I also felt that the cake needed more extract so next time I will add a tbs of the vanilla and 1/2 tbs almond. I cut the sugar down by 1/2 cup as I felt 3 cups would be too sweet. I think if you are going to use a glaze then the sugar can be reduced an additional 1/4 cup ( I don’t like overly sweet cakes)Also, beat the sugar and butter for the 7 to 10 minutes as suggested by others. I think this is a helpful step. I only used 3 sticks of butter as per a few other reviews, it was greasy. I baked at 325 degrees for the suggested time. Cake came out perfect. Moist. Nice crumb. Won’t choke you. Not greasy. Haven’t had a good pound cake in a loooong while and this hits the spot. It’s been 4 days since I baked it and last piece is still moist and the flavor is better. So I would suggest baking this a day or two before you serve it. I am baking another one later. This is a keeper! ( I gave it a 4 star only because of the changes that had to be made)
It's a hit everytime. I macerate strawberries and serve with home made whip cream. Loved my all!
I have now made this several times. It is the best recipe. The one change I made was I added LorAnn Bakery Emulsion to it. It took an already amazing cake to the next level. Thanks for sharing! :)

This is the perfect pound cake recipe. It’s easy, quick, and bakes up beautifully. I overheard comments of, “just like Grandma’s” and “grab the rest of the cake and let’s go!” Followed the recipe exactly. I recommend this recipe!

This was the first pound cake I have ever made...It turned out perfect...You would have to know me to realize that I am no cook...I took this to my neighbor who invited me to Easter dinner...Her family loved it...I have one in the oven now and if I don’t get to excited, I will get a photo of this one..
Just made this cake today and it is amazing !

This is the second time I made this cake and both times, people didn't like it. This time I only put a tiny pinch of mace since the first time I used too much and that was off putting to people. Another mistake I made the first time was over beating the ingredients- I gently folded in the dry ingredients until just combined and the texture was much better. I don't know what it is, even with those two fixes, no one really ate the cake. In general I much prefer homemade stuff to store bought but this cake doesn't capture the richness or the texture of a store pound cake that so many like. Maybe its the bundt pan? I don't know but I don't think I'll be giving it a third chance.

Sounds like the same cake a friend use to make in SC it was delicious, but she wouldn’t share her recipe, so I’m glade you shared yours. I haven’t made it yet, but I plan to. Hope mine turns out as lovely.
Followed the recipe exactly. Wonderful!

love this recipe. I and extra egg yolks (2) and found it very moist and delicious. It also was enough for two cakes and i added pomegranates to one and OM goodness! Amazing. I have an abundance of them and have been looking for ways to use them other than juicing.
Worst cake I ever made. Too much butter, too much sugar, didn't cook, too oily. Yuk! Only rated one star because I had to.
The very delicious cake, make it with strawberry n whip cream on top. Everyone at dinner enjoyed it.

Love this recipe. I only make two adjustments. I love lemon flavor so I add a teaspoon of lemon extract for a subtle hint. Then I spray my bundt pan with baker's spray, then I coat/"flour" it with granulated sugar. It gives the cake a wonderful little surprise, crisp sweetness on the outside.
Delicious and beautiful. I served mine with an orange glaze and fresh mixed fruit. Everyone loved it and not a crumb was left on anyone's plate.

I have made this quite a few time in the past. I followed the recipe. The only thing I differently was add a orange glaze to 
cake. I bake cake at 350. The top did darken quite a bit.
After I was finished I reread the reviews and see several people
bake cake at 325 due to this. Must have bake cake at 325
the last time because I don't remember top of cake darkening
like it did at 350. Will bake again
I didn't use any mace I used 1 teaspoon of baking powder and 1-1/2 tablespoon of vanilla extract I baked it on 315 instead of 350 I also made a sour cream icing to put on top of the cake Deelishis

This was the best pound cake I've ever tasted!! I didn't make a single substitution. It doesn't need anything extra or different!! This recipe is definitely a keeper and I will definitely be making it again!!

My husband is in love with this cake. The only change I made was omitting the mace, simply because I did not have it on hand. After reading several reviews, I thought it safe not to use it and I simply do not know how this cake could be any better.
This was a very good pound cake. I baked it for my co-worker and her and her boyfriend loved it. One suggestion is to lower the temp to 325 degrees instead of 350. It browned very quickly.

Good, simple recipe with several changes. Omitted the mace. Not common so don't sweat it if you don't have. Just add a touch of vanilla as this recipe doesn't call for enough. 2 TSP is needed. Add 1/2 TSP Baking Powder. Needed a bit of air. And no way need as much butter. Cut in half. At 350, its 55-60 minutes. Use lower rack. Butter foil and cover last 15 minutes.
Love the cake. It was so buttery and tasted great.

Best pound cake recipe for me. I use it as the base for my Raspberry Trifle which I serve for Christmas dinner desert. Any leftover cake morsels get gobbled up quickly. It is so delicious with a cup of hot tea.
Made just like the recipe said and it came out great. It does above the top of the pan so make sure you put something under it in the oven. Will make this again for Christmas.
In my opinion, it was very moist and tasty but I didn't give it 5 stars because it was too dense for my taste.
It was ok. Not one of my favorites. Not a tender pound cake kind of course. But came nicely out of the pan and the flavor was just ok. Although that being said, my husband loved it.

I made this for a party tomorrow and it's a mess. It was too much for my Bundt pan so I left about 1 inch at the top and put the excess in a small Bundt. The big pan is dripping all over the oven and the small pan fell. I haven't had this kind of catastrophe in years and years. I'm not sure what went wrong. I thought maybe I'd whipped the butter too long but in reading the reviews I don't think that's it. I live at an altitude of 4000+ feet but generally I don't make any modifications to recipes. I'm baffled and very disappointed. Now I'll have to make another. :(
This recipe did not work out for me
Wonderful. When it comes to pound cake, my husband is very, very picky! He loved it!!!
This cake is crazy delicious! Rich and almost creamy! Yum!
Super tasty. Only change was cutting the mace; however, baking time was just under an hour. Be sure to check this one often or you may end up with burnt cake.

Cake was delicious. However, it formed a crusty top which cracked and came off. Any ideas how to keep this from happening ? Baked 1 hr. 20 mins. at 325 degrees. I have baked this for holidays and added 1 cup pecans. Never had crust like this before. Thank you,
This was very good. Took it to church and came home with none.

I made this to take to a going away party at work for a colleague. It was a total hit! I had people IMing me all afternoon asking if I made the Bunt cake and could they have the recipe. The only thing different I did was to add a tsp. of lemon extract because I like it. Obviously, I wasn't the only one.

This recipe truly makes a lovely cake. Beautiful color, texture, crumb and taste. Despite a couple of really negative reviews can so many positive reviews be wrong? Everyone loved it at our dinner last night. I drizzled a simple icing over it but it could have stood on its own easily.
I made one bundt cake & had enough batter to make a medium sized loaf as well. Baking time was right on though I turned the heat to 325 for the last 10 mins. I may have reduced the sugar by about 1/3 c.. I followed the suggestions of other reviewers to beat the butter/sugar for 10 mins. It takes that longs to get to the fluffy, light-colored stage. An easy delicious cake. Will make it again. UPDATE: I just doubled the recipe and got 8 tin foil loaf pans of this cake.

This is the best pound cake I have ever had! I make it almost exactly as directed with the only exception being I don't use mace. I have never bought that and it is fabulous without it. It is not too anything and I have always gotten rave reviews when I make it. Goes great with a cup of black coffee after dinner. Ingore the haters and just follow the recipe and you will have a winner

I am a southerner and southerners love their Pound Cake, and this one is mighty good! I'm not really sure if most folks understand that a really good pound cake is dense, moist and if baked correctly, will emerge from the pan with a lovely buttery and brown crust, which makes it absolutely delicious. Pound cakes are not suppose to be "light" in texture, so those who are looking for that type of cake need to look elsewhere. This recipe is FABULOUS!!!

I absolutely loved this recipe. After reading a few reviews, I did tweek it a little. I added 1/4 tsp of baking powder and I added 2 tsp of almond extract and 1 tsp of vanilla. I also turned the oven to 325 degrees for 1 hour and 20 minutes. I thought the sugar was too much, but some how it came out great and not overly sweet. It also was very moist!!!
I made No changes. This cake is perfect. Keeps well, and holds together great.

this is my first time making pound cake. it turned out real moist . I would definitely make it again.but I think I would add more vanilla and more mace in the I would use real butterhopefully that would give it a little bit better flavoring.
I added almond extract and vanilla no mace and for glaze I added butted and almond extract
Excellent pound cake. I changed the flour to cake flour and added 3 cups plus 6 teaspoons of cake flour. I also didn't have mace so I used cinnamon. Moist, dense great flavor pound cake.
I followed the recipe exactly as it is printed The cake fell,I think it was too much butter.
Too much butter.

This was my very first attempt at a pound cake. It was so easy! I had heard that pound cakes were hard, aggravating. Not this one. It tasted just like I remember my "Grandma's" tasting. It was buttery, moist, and had a soft texture. My husband said to definitely remember this one. I would recommend this one for anyone.
My first time ever baking a cake without the help of Dunkin Hines and it was delicious!!!!
It was good, but I couldn't find any mace, so I use nutmeg instead, I mean mace is just the outer coating of nutmeg, so it would taste, and react similar to mace than anything else
Very moist and rich.

No baker, just really getting into baking... this cake is wonder & very.easy to make !! :-)
I followed recipe then after placing batter in pans l added fresh frozen peaches in one of the cake pans.
For the top layer of my cake.
Im baking a birthday cake for someone an they love peaches.
It turned out really good an moist
It did take 5min more longer to bake for the cake batter l added the peaches to- than other, probably be be same time if l would have added fresh or defrosted fruit.
I put cream cheese frosting between the cakes, l set the cake with peaches on top. Used chocolate fudge frosting to finish.

I was a little concerned over how much sugar this recipe calls for, but I tried it anyway. Should have trusted my instincts. This cake is much too sweet. It was, however, very moist but I had to bake it for 30 minutes longer than what the recipe indicates. Won't be giving this one a second try.

I have made this recipe several times and it always turns out great and gets rave reviews. This time my 14yr old niece helped and was a little rough with the "folding" in of the dry ingredients but the cake turned out perfectly. I added 1TBS of vanilla. It was so moist we ate it straight off the plate without whipped cream! Next time I'll try adding some orange or lemon extract for a change.

Made this recipe 2 times today. Needed it for a "Bag lunch" I am doing for Relay of Life tomorrow. Best pound cake I has ever tasted. My eggs were a little small so I used 7 eggs in this cake. Next time I make it I will try cutting the butter to 1 1/2 cups.
This was a big hit for the holidays. My family loved it

Excellent when I made adjustments recommended by most other reviewers (reduce sugar to 2 1/4 cups, add 1/4 tsp baking powder, increased vanilla to 2 tsp). Definitely make with 1 pound of butter as this IS a pound cake (thus, the name)! If you don't like a very moist, buttery cake this isn't for you. My family loved it and I will make it often.
Wow!! This is my grandmother's sour cream pound cake recipe too!! It is always a hit at every holiday or get together. I love the flavor the mace brings to the recipe.
The best I've ever had. Turns our perfect every time.
This taste yummy the mace gives it an extra kick
This cake was so moist & delicious, I didn't add 1 tsp. of salt, I only used 1/4 tsp & it came out perfect. Thanks for this recipe. I will be making it often.
The cake comes out to be light and wonderfully flavorful, though I admit I followed one reviewer's suggestion and increased the amount of vanilla by a bit when I found I didn't have mace.
This is absolutely the best recipe for pound cake I've ever made. Didn't use mace and made a confection icing with fresh lemon. Outdstanding.

Let me say initially, if a recipe requires this many modifications, I don't hold it as a good recipe for me. However, I did add more vanilla and the baking soda. The top puffed up, separated from the cake, and even though I covered it loosely with foil when I realized it was browning so quickly, it still was crusty and ultimately flaked off the cake. In the end there were dense, unbaked pockets at the bottom. Won't use again. :/
My family enjoys this cake. I bake it frequently .

I just took this out of the oven about an hour ago!!! I didn't have any mace, I did add some lemon zest to it. I had to cut it and try a piece warm, it did not disappoint!!!! Great pound cake, not dry!!!! This is another keeper from this site!!!!!!!! I did put this in a cold oven, did not preheat and cooked it for an hr. and 15 min. and it came out perfect!!!!!!
